description: Stefano Tsorotiotis, a University of Oklahoma tennis standout who qualified for the NCAA doubles tournament as a sophomore, has transferred to UC Santa Barbara for his final two years of competition, Gaucho coach Marty Davis announced Wednesday. Tsorotiotis and doubles partner Alex Bakshi climbed to No. 21 in the ITA Doubles Rankings during the 2019 season...
text:
Stefano Tsorotiotis, a University of Oklahoma tennis standout who qualified
for the NCAA doubles tournament as a sophomore, has transferred to UC Santa
Barbara for his final two years of competition, Gaucho coach Marty Davis
announced Wednesday.

Tsorotiotis and doubles partner Alex Bakshi climbed to No. 21 in the ITA
Doubles Rankings during the 2019 season and were ultimately selected for the
NCAA doubles tournament and named All-Big 12. They defeated four top-25
opponents while playing in the No. 1 doubles position.

"We are extremely excited about having Stefano, a great student with both NCAA
Team and Individual Championship experience, join us here at UCSB," Davis
said. "His credentials suggest he'll play in our top doubles pairing as well
as provide added punch to a very solid Gaucho singles line-up."

The Gauchos return ace Joseph Guillin for a repeat senior season after this
past season was cancelled by the COVID-19 pandemic.

The addition of Tsorotiotis bolsters an already impressive recruiting class
for UCSB. Newcomers Kai Brady, Pablo Masjuan and Jett Cole give UCSB a rating
of 20th best in the nation by Tennis Recruiting Network. The incoming Gauchos
are the highest-ranked class amongst all mid-major universities and rate above
both USC's (#21) and UCLA's (#25) recruiting classes.

A native of Libertyville, Ill., Tsorotiotis attended IMG Academy in Bradenton,
Fla., and Libertyville High School in his hometown. He was a USTA National
Singles and doubles champion and a two-time regional champion.

In addition to his athletic accomplishments, Tsorotiotis was an ITA Academic
Scholar Athlete, First Team Academic All-Big 12, a member of Oklahoma's
President's Honor Roll and a member of the Dean's Honor Roll for the Price
College of Business.

title: Top Doubles Player from Oklahoma Transfers to UCSB
html:
Stefano Tsorotiotis, a University of Oklahoma tennis standout who qualified for the NCAA doubles tournament as a sophomore, has transferred to UC Santa Barbara for his final two years of competition, Gaucho coach Marty Davis announced Wednesday.

Tsorotiotis and doubles partner Alex Bakshi climbed to No. 21 in the ITA Doubles Rankings during the 2019 season and were ultimately selected for the NCAA doubles tournament and named All-Big 12. They defeated four top-25 opponents while playing in the No. 1 doubles position.

"We are extremely excited about having Stefano, a great student with both NCAA Team and Individual Championship experience, join us here at UCSB," Davis said. "His credentials suggest he'll play in our top doubles pairing as well as provide added punch to a very solid Gaucho singles line-up."

The Gauchos return ace Joseph Guillin for a repeat senior season after this past season was cancelled by the COVID-19 pandemic.

The addition of Tsorotiotis bolsters an already impressive recruiting class for UCSB. Newcomers Kai Brady, Pablo Masjuan and Jett Cole give UCSB a rating of 20th best in the nation by Tennis Recruiting Network. The incoming Gauchos are the highest-ranked class amongst all mid-major universities and rate above both USC's (#21) and UCLA's (#25) recruiting classes.

A native of Libertyville, Ill., Tsorotiotis attended IMG Academy in Bradenton, Fla., and Libertyville High School in his hometown. He was a USTA National Singles and doubles champion and a two-time regional champion.

In addition to his athletic accomplishments, Tsorotiotis was an ITA Academic Scholar Athlete, First Team Academic All-Big 12, a member of Oklahoma's President's Honor Roll and a member of the Dean's Honor Roll for the Price College of Business.
